intro: Odontarrhena smolikana, commonly known as the African grassveld daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white to pale blue petals. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and is adapted to arid and semi-arid conditions. It has fibrous roots and produces small, oblong seeds that are dispersed by wind. Odontarrhena smolikana is often used in local horticulture for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
